Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Hmm let me start by carefully reading the users query Theyve provided a detailed process description with strict rules and desiderata along with an event log for three cases My task is to analyze each case against the normative constraints and desiderata

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First I need to parse the normative rules clearly The sequence must be Application Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant if approved Finalize Documentation Close Case if rejected Close Case directly No skipping or reordering and documentation must only happen after approval

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Looking at Case 1 the sequence seems perfect All steps are in order and since its approved documentation is done before closing No issues here with normative rules Desideratawise I should check timing Credit Check is just 30 minutes after application well within 24 hours Inform Applicant is 2 hours after decision within 48 hours No followup call mentioned but thats optional so no violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 immediately stands out Risk Assessment happens before Credit Checkthats a clear normative violation because credit check must precede risk assessment Also after rejection they finalized documentation which is strictly prohibited So two major normative breaches here Desiderata might not even be relevant because the process is already invalid

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 3 has the sequence correct normatively Approved documentation close so no issue there But timing Credit Check is 2 days after application more than 24 hours and Inform Applicant is 2 days after decision more than 48 hours Both are desiderata violations No followup call but thats just a recommendation so okay

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now for justifications Case 2s errors seem like process breakdownsmaybe the assessor jumped the gun on risk assessment without waiting for credit check and then someone mistakenly processed documentation after rejection Could be human error or system flaw Case 3s delays might be due to workload but since its not a hard rule its just suboptimal Case 1 is ideal

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: I should structure the response clearly list normative violations per case then desiderata failures then possible interpretations Make sure to emphasize that desiderata are not critical but still worth noting
